resources.string: "Golf is a puzzle without an answer. I've played the game for 50 years and still haven't the slightest idea of how to play."
"I know I am getting better at golf because I am hitting fewer spectators."
"Golf is a game invented by the same people who think music comes out of bagpipes."
"Success in golf depends less on strength of body than upon strength of mind and character."
"They call it golf because all the other four-letter words were taken."
"Golf is a game of respect and sportsmanship; we have to respect its traditions and its rules."
"Golf is the closest game to the game we call life. You get bad breaks from good shots; you get good breaks from bad shots—but you have to play the ball where it lies."
"The reason the pro tells you to keep your head down is so you can't see him laughing."
"You can talk strategy all you want, but at the end of the day, execution is what wins the game."
"A bad attitude is worse than a bad swing."
"Golf is like a love affair: If you don’t take it seriously, it’s no fun. If you do take it seriously, it breaks your heart."
"Some people think they are concentrating when they’re merely worrying."
"The most important shot in golf is the next one."
"If you think it’s hard to meet new people, try picking up the wrong golf ball."
"Golf is about how well you accept, respond to, and score with your misses much more than it is a game of your perfect shots."
"No matter how good you get, you can always get better—that’s the beauty of the game."
"Golf teaches you honesty, patience, and humility—because the game will humble you."
"My swing is like an octopus falling out of a tree."
"Golf is the only game where you can’t play defense, which is why it’s so hard."
"Every shot counts. The only thing you can control is your preparation and your mindset."
"It's not the will to win that matters—everyone has that. It's the will to prepare to win that matters."
"The best wood in my bag is a pencil."
"A bad day at golf is still better than a good day at work."
"Golf is a game of inches—the most important are the six inches between your ears."
"Golf: A game where you yell 'fore,' shoot six, and write down five."
"Golf teaches you patience. If you're not patient, you’ll learn the hard way."
"A good golfer has the determination to win and the patience to wait for the breaks."
"I have a tip that can take five strokes off anyone’s game: It’s called an eraser."
"The beauty of golf is that no two rounds are ever the same, just like no two days in life are ever identical."
